xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: Researches of the first and second authors were supported in part by NSF grant DMS-0456625 and by a joint USA-Slovene grant, and by a grant from the Ministry of Science of Slovenia, respectively. The first author gratefully acknowledges hospitality and support during his visit at the University of Ljubljana.

head.citation-title: Orthogonality preserving bijective maps on finite dimensional projective spaces over division rings
head.abstracts: Let [image omitted] be a finite dimensional right vector space over a division ring , equipped with a nondegenerate semi-sesquilinear inner product ,. Let D and E be bijective linear operators on [image omitted]. The operators D and E induce indefinite inner products on [image omitted], by the formulas Dx,y and Ex,y , where [image omitted]. We study maps on the projective space over [image omitted] that send D-orthogonal one-dimensional subspaces (elements of the projective space) to E-orthogonal one-dimensional subspaces. We prove that under the assumption of bijectivity of the map, and assuming n 3, such a map T preserves (D, E )-orthogonality if and only if it preserves (D, E )-orthogonality in both directions. In this case, it is induced by a semilinear transformation on [image omitted] that is (D, E )-unitary up to a multiplicative constant. For n = 3, it turns out the injectivity assumption alone suffices to reach the same conclusion. The main results are specialized to the particular cases when is the (commutative) complex field and the (noncommutative) skew field of real quaternions. In particular, the existence of (D, E )-unitary semilinear maps is discussed in these cases.
